Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2008 01:16PM strongmom37 wrote: Hi Lucy..today is day 8 and I feel almost normal again. It took until day 6 to feel back that way. I will definitely go into next tx on 30th better hydrated to begin with and make sure ask if I can take the zofran more often. Just went and picked out my wig today. Will be able to pick it up next week, just in time for my hair to be shedding like crazy!
Posts.Title: First day of chemo! strongmom37 Lucy47

Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2008 03:28PM strongmom37 wrote: It is only 6:30pm and I want to take my antinausea drugs now, but then I am not supposed to take anymore until tomorrow morning...what If i get more nauseous later....I should have asked if I could take more often if I get super nauseous...it had definitely hit me hard. lets hope for a better tomorrow!!
Posts.Title: First day of chemo! strongmom37 Lucy47

Posts.Content: strongmom37 wrote: Had my first dose of chemo this morning. I don't know what I was expecting, but it was not that bad. I thought I would have a bit of a freak out while the Red Devil was going in, but my nurse was so awsome talking to me kind of distracting me. So now I am home and almost feel like a ticking time bomb waiting for some sort of side effects to start! I guess I could be lucky and not have anything more than some mild nausea...at least til my hair falls out in 14-18 days! we will see. I go back tomorrow for my Neulasta shot. Dx 8/28/2008, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 3, 6/15 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: First day of chemo! strongmom37 Lucy47

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2008 09:15PM strongmom37 wrote: hi everyone. I had my first treatment, A/C, on Thursday. I have been in rough shape since. They gave me zofran and decodran to take for 3 days, but I am still super nauseaus and it is SO hard to drink my water or anything. I went in for my neulasta shot yesterday and they gave me some IV fluids which helped me get through last night, but today i can barely get off the couch to do anything. 3 more to go...I know I can make it but this first round was much harder than I thought. I am usually a pretty tough cookie. It is helpfull reading about everyone's tips on getting through it.
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2008 12:23PM strongmom37 wrote: I should get some zantac..I have got the burps constantly and never had heartburn, even while pregnant, until now! I love spicy foods and found that they have been my worst enemy so far..although come on sandy, common sense there with that one right! Lots of carbs, which I don't normally eat, have been helpful.
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2008 11:49AM strongmom37 wrote: Hi. I am kinda new here. I started chemo on 10/16 A/C every 2wks 4cycles then Taxol/Herceptin for 12 weeks. I have posted a few times on other posts. Always feel like they have been so negative..sorry. Today is the first day I am feeling almost normal physically. It is 7 days out from first treatment. I only have 6 more days to feel ok before round 2. It was a tough 4 days or so for me after that first one. Staying hydrated seemed to be my issue! I think I already have a dose of "chemo brain" too! I lost my keys last Friday and still can't find them.....I have an appt tomorrow to get fitted for a wig. I have really enjoyed being on these boards the last few weeks and reading about all the other great strong ladies on here going through all this. We are not alone fortunately and unfortunately!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique
